title: 6cov cannot resolve symbol locations on darwin
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. apply http://golang.org/cl/4277046/ to get 6cov running on darwin
2. make -C pkg/fmt coverage

What is the expected output?

I've never seen a correct output from 6cov, but I guess it would be something from this 
function inside main.c:missing()

		// never entered function
		print("%s:%d %s never called (%#llux-%#llux)\n", shortname(file), line1, s.name, pc, epc);

What do you see instead?

...
mallocs per Sprintf(""): 1
mallocs per Sprintf("xxx"): 2
mallocs per Sprintf("%x"): 2
mallocs per Sprintf("%x %x"): 2
PASS
0x14457-0x1445c
0x14564-0x14635
0x14643-0x14648
0x146f8-0x146fd
0x147f2-0x147f7
0x148a7-0x148ac
0x148da-0x148df
0x14a6c-0x14a71
...

^ this output comes from the notfound: label in main.c:missing()

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?

6g

Which operating system are you using?

darwin
Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)

tip

Please provide any additional information below.

I've added some debugging to missing.c

	fs = findsym(pc, CTEXT, &s);
	fl = fileline(file, sizeof file, pc);
	if(!fs || !fl) {
	notfound:
		print("findsym: %s, findline %d, %#llux-%#llux\n", s.name, fl, pc, epc);
		// print("%#llux-%#llux\n", pc, epc);
		return;
	}

and the output points to fileline() failing 

PASS
findsym: /Users/dave/go/src/pkg/fmt/_xtest_.TestFmtInterface, findline 0, 0x14457-0x1445c
findsym: /Users/dave/go/src/pkg/fmt/_xtest_.TestFmtInterface, findline 0, 0x14564-0x14635
findsym: /Users/dave/go/src/pkg/fmt/_xtest_.I路String, findline 0, 0x14643-0x14648
findsym: /Users/dave/go/src/pkg/fmt/_xtest_.F路Format, findline 0, 0x146f8-0x146fd
findsym: /Users/dave/go/src/pkg/fmt/_xtest_.G路GoString, findline 0, 0x147f2-0x147f7
findsym: /Users/dave/go/src/pkg/fmt/_xtest_.*P路String, findline 0, 0x148a7-0x148ac
findsym: /Users/dave/go/src/pkg/fmt/_xtest_.TestSprintf, findline 0, 0x148da-0x148df

Any suggestions on where to proceed would be very welcome.
